subject: Productivity
title: The Glucose-Brain Connection
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Glucose-Brain Connection usable.

hook.text: Your brain is 2% of your body weight but uses 20% of your energy. It's the hungriest organ you have.

buildup.text: The brain runs almost entirely on glucose. When blood sugar drops, thinking gets foggy and slow.

discovery.text: Baumeister's research linked low glucose to poor decisions. Judges granted more paroles after eating lunch.

twist.text: But the brain doesn't need sugar spikes. Steady glucose from complex carbs beats candy bar energy every time.

climax.text: Peak mental performance depends on steady fuel, not sudden bursts. Feed the brain like a marathon, not a sprint.

punchline.text: Your brain runs on glucose. Feed it steadily.

quiz.question: What percentage of body energy does the brain consume?
